business.headline: Sensex gains, Nifty loses: Markets stay range-bound as cautious sentiment prevailsThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 147.71 points to close at 74,602.12, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 5.80 points to end at 22,547.55.

RBI withdrawal relief for New India Co-op Bank depositors. Check details hereThis announcement comes just over a week after the central bank prohibited the bank from issuing new loans, dissolved its board and took control owing to 'supervisory concerns.'

Sell India, Buy China: Why FIIs are falling out of love with Dalal StreetDalal Street has witnessed correction over the past six months, with the Nifty50 plummeting from 25,200 levels to around 22,500 levels by the end of February 2025.

Reliance bets big on Assam, to invest Rs 50,000 crore in next 5 yearsManaging Director Mukesh Ambani announced an investment of Rs 50,000 crore in Assam. A major part of Reliance's investment will be directed towards making Assam a leader in technology and artificial intelligence (AI).
Hungary announces tax exemption for mothers with 2 or more children The said announcement comes ahead of the 2026 elections and is a part of Orban's efforts to boost the country's birth rate.

DBS set to cut 4,000 jobs over 3 years due to AI, says CEODBS CEO Piyush Gupta said the bank will shrink its workforce by 10% in the next three years due to artificial intelligence replacing human roles.

Hein Schumacher to step down as Unilever CEO in MarchThe departure comes just weeks after Unilever announced underwhelming full-year earnings and chose Amsterdam over London and New York as the primary listing for its ice cream business.
Explained: Why Tata Investment share price jumped 10% todayAt around 12:56 pm, shares of the non-banking financial company were up 7.65% to Rs 6,195.85 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

What is Universal Pension Scheme? Here's all you need to know With India's senior citizen population aged 60 years and above expected to touch 227 million by 2036, a comprehensive social security or pension scheme is necessary.

Adani Group commits to invest Rs 50,000 crore in Assam. Details hereThe investment will focus on infrastructure projects aimed at transforming Assam into a major economic hub. Funds will be allocated to sectors such as airports, aero cities, city gas distribution, transmission networks, cement production, and road projects, with the goal of enhancing connectivity and industrial capacity.

New Tax Regime: Income up to Rs 13.7 lakh can be tax-free. Here's howFollowing the Union Budget 2025, annual income up to Rs 12 lakh became tax-free. But there's a way to push it even further to Rs 13.7 lakh.

Sebi proposes tighter rules for index derivatives. Here's what it meansIn a consultation paper released late Monday, Sebi said it wants to link stock derivative position limits to the cash market. The idea is to cap the market-wide position limit at the lower of 15% of a stock's free-float market cap or 60 times its average daily delivery value.

Dalal Street holiday: Is the stock market open or close on Maha Shivratri 2025?Stock markets usually operate from Monday to Friday, except on declared holidays. They remain closed on Saturdays and Sundays.

Tata Capital IPO to soon make Dalal Street debut as board clears listing plansTata Capital will be the first company from the Tata Group to launch an IPO since Tata Technologies went public in November 2023.

Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak to open higher, but FII selling remains concernThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 81.16 points to 74,535.57, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 11.40 points to 22,564.75 as of 9:25 AM.
Donald Trump's latest order triggers sharp sell-off in China tech stocksThe Hang Seng Tech Index dropped by as much as 4.4% on Tuesday, marking its biggest fall since November.

Tata Play, Airtel Digital TV near merger as DTH fights streaming wave: Report The merger is expected to be done through a share swap, allowing Airtel to increase its non-mobile revenue by offering a combination of telecom, broadband, and DTH services.

New India Co-op Bank depositors get relief as RBI allows Rs 25,000 withdrawal Withdrawals can be made through branches or ATMs, but the total amount a depositor can withdraw will be capped at Rs 25,000 or the balance available in their account, whichever is lower.

RBI plans to eliminate loan foreclosure charges and prepayment penalties The central bank has invited feedback from the public and stakeholders on a draft circular directing banks not to levy foreclosure charges and pre-payment penalties on loans by March 21, 2025.

These 3 banks slash loan interest rates after RBI's repo rate cut The RBI, after a gap of five years, announced a reduction in the repo rate by 25 bps to 6.25%. A dip in the repo rate can lead to lower interest rates on loans, thereby making loans cheaper, and vice versa.

Will Donald Trump's tariffs hurt India? Here's what S&P saysIn its latest report, titled 'Asia-Pacific Economies Likely To Be Hit By US Trade Tariffs', S&P pointed out that countries like Vietnam, Taiwan, Thailand, and South Korea have stronger trade ties with the US.
Dalal Street ends in red: Sensex loses over 850 points, IT stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 856.55 points to close at 74,454.41, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 242.55 points to end at 22,553.35.

Tax planning 2025: 3 easy ways to maximise tax savings before March 31One can invest in Equity Linked Saving Schemes (ELSS), Public Provident Fund (PPF), life insurance premiums, National Savings Certificate (NSC) and tax-saving fixed deposits, to claim deductions of up to Rs 1,50,000.

Nifty set for longest losing run in 28 years. Should you be worried?The Nifty losing for five months straight is a rare sight. Last time this happened was in 1996, and before that in 1994-95, when it fell 31.4% over eight months. Right now, the index has fallen over 11% since October.

Former ICICI Bank chief Chanda Kochhar launches podcast Chanda Kochhar, 63, joined ICICI Bank in 1984 and worked her way up to become its Managing Director (MD) and Chief Executive Officer (CEO) in 2009.

Will RBI reduce lending rates again in April policy meeting?The recent MPC meeting, held from February 5-7, saw all members agreeing that a rate cut was needed to support slowing economic growth, as inflation was no longer a major concern.

NPS, PPF, or mutual funds: Which SIP investment should you opt for? Are you looking to invest in SIP but unsure where to put your money? Read to know whether you should opt for PPF, NPS, or mutual funds.

Income Tax Bill: What is clubbing of income under family taxation In certain cases, income earned by an individual can be included in another taxpayer's income. In such cases, the latter is eligible to pay taxes not only on his income but also on the income of the other person as well.

Sensex, Nifty in red. 5 things to know about stock market bloodbathSeveral factors are behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street, especially the exodus of foreign institutional investors (FIIs) who have sold stocks over Rs 2 lakh crore since October 2024.
Earning up to Rs 12.75 lakh? Why you should opt for new income tax regimeEarlier, taxpayers earning up to Rs 7 lakh paid nil taxes under the new regime. Now that limit has been raised to Rs 12 lakh.

Sensex tanks 800 points: 3 reasons why stock market is falling todayThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 676.83 points to 74,634.23, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 203.05 points to 22,592.85 as of 10 AM. IT stocks were the worst hit, with HCLTech falling nearly 3%.
Stock market opens in red: Sensex down 700 points. HCLTech falls 3%The S&P BSE Sensex lost 672.83 points to 74,638.23, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 216.80 points to 22,579.10 as of 9:40 AM.

FII selling dampens investor sentiment on Dalal Street: When will it stop? Foreign institutional investors (FII) have been on a selling spree which has hampered investor sentiment on Dalal Street, affecting Sensex and Nifty as they are moving funds to other markets.

Quality Power IPO listing: Will it make a strong market debut? Check latest GMPQuality Power IPO opened for subscription on February 14, 2025, aiming to raise Rs 858.70 crore. The public issue consisted of a fresh issue of 53 lakh shares worth Rs 225 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of 1.49 crore shares worth Rs 633.70 crore.

Meta rewards executives with 200% bonuses despite ongoing job cutsThe bonus for top executives was increased to 200% from 75% and the decision was approved by Meta's Compensation, Nominating, and Governance Committee (CNGC) after recent layoff.

Health insurance: 4 tips to reduce premiums for senior citizens Purchasing a health insurance policy at a younger age can help in securing reduced premium rates. Generally, lower insurance premiums are offered to younger people as they are considered low risk.

Index Funds vs. ETFs: 5 key things every investor should know Exchange-Traded Funds are traded like shares on the stock market and can be sold or purchased at existing market prices during the day, while Index Funds are traded only once at the closure of the share market.

ICMAI demands 'accountant' status for cost accountants in new Income Tax BillIn its memorandum, ICMAI highlighted the extensive training of Cost and Management Accountants (CMAs), which includes expertise in taxation, finance, auditing, corporate laws, and strategic risk management.

New tax regime: 3 deductions that can help taxpayers maximise savings  Though the new regime offered concessional tax rates, it reduced several popular deductions and exemptions, like HRA, LTA, interest on home loans, Section 80C, and more.

AI to take centre stage at the 3rd Digital News Publishers Association ConclaveThrough various keynote sessions, panel discussions and expert presentations, this year's DNPA Conclave aims to decode various critical issues, future strategies, opportunities and models that can power an equitable, inclusive and sustainable digital media ecosystem in an era of rapid technological advancement.

entertainment.headline: Internet calls Farah Khan 'insensitive' for mocking Gaurav Khanna's colour blindnessCelebrity MasterChef judge Farah Khan mocked TV actor Gaurav Khanna's colour blindness on the show. Following the same, the internet is outraged by her comments, criticising the filmmaker and calling her 'insensitive'.

Parineeti Chopra gears up for her first Netflix yet-to-be-titled thriller seriesActor Parineeti Chopra is set to make her series OTT debut with a Netflix project. The actor shared a post and informed about sharing screen space with Nimrit Kaur, Soni Razdan, and others.

Tanmay Bhat's X account hacked, comedian warns followersTanmay Bhat's X account recently got hacked, leading to fraudulent messages being posted online. The comedian shared a post on his Instagram and warned his followers.

Prajakta Koli-Vrishank Khanal can't take their eyes off each other in haldi picsActor Prajakta Koli is set to marry longtime boyfriend Vrishank Khanan on February 25. Ahead of the grand day, the actor shared pictures from her haldi function.

Anupam Mittal on India's Got Latent backlash: Not a lost episode of Satyamev JayateAnupam Mittal weighs in on the India's Got Latent row, arguing that YouTube should also be held accountable. He calls Big Tech the real culprit, criticising digital platforms for fueling outrage-driven content.

Bobby Deol says Aashram helped him break industry image, explore new rolesActor Bobby Deol is all set to return as Baba Nirala in Prakash Jha's series, Aashram 3 part 2. The actor confessed that he wanted to step out of his comfort zone.

Waking of Nation trailer: Taaruk Raina fights to prove Jallianwala Bagh was plannedA new show that explores the events surrounding the Jallianwala Bagh massacre is set to premiere on Sony LIV on March 8. Starring Taaruk Raina in the lead role, the series is titled The Waking of a Nation.
Singer Justin Bieber responds to rumours of drug useJustin Bieber's representative has reacted to the reports of the singer's drug use and called them false.

Ranveer Allahbadia runs to car after recording statement in Latent probeRanveer Allahbadia was clicked in a hurried state, running towards his car as the paparazzi tried to capture his pictures on Monday. The YouTuber visited the Maharashtra Cyber office in Mahape after recording his statement.

Kaushaljis vs Kaushal review: A simple yet complex tale of second chance in loveReleased-Fri Feb 21, 2025Kaushaljis vs Kaushal movie review: This film is a heartfelt exploration of second chances in love, focusing on a middle-aged couple navigating the complexities of separation and familial expectations. Set in the relatable backdrop of Kannauj, the film captivates with its simplicity and stellar performances.

Dupahiya trailer: A wedding, a missing bike and a lot of chaos in offingThe first full trailer of Prime Video's upcoming comedy series, Dupahiya, is here. The show will feature actors such as Sparsh Shrivastava and Gajraj Rao in pivotal roles.

Bride-to-Be Prajakta Koli dances to Zingaat with fiance at mehndi ceremony. WatchPrajakta Koli shared glimpses of her mehndi ceremony as she danced joyfully with fiance Vrishank Khanal. The couple is set to marry on February 25.

general news.headline: Sajjan Kumar, ex-Congress MP, sentenced to life in jail in anti-Sikh riots caseFormer Congress MP Sajjan Kumar has been sentenced to life imprisonment for his involvement in the killing of two Sikhs in the 1984 riots. This is his second life sentence, as he is already serving time for his role in the Delhi Cantonment riots case.

AAP's Delhi liquor policy led to Rs 2,002 crore revenue loss: CAG reportThe Comptroller and Auditor General of India report on the now-scrapped Delhi liquor policy scam was tabled in the Assembly today by Chief Minister Rekha Gupta.

Preity Zinta vs Kerala Congress: Full-blown fight over bank's Rs 18 crore loanPreity Zinita called reports of New India Cooperative Bank writing off her Rs 18-crore loan false. She blasted Congress for promoting fake news by linking her with Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP).

Atishi, 20 AAP MLAs suspended after chaos over CAG report in Delhi AssemblyAs the Delhi Assembly session commenced for the day, Lt Governor VK Saxena's address to the House was disrupted by AAP legislators as they resorted to loud sloganeering against the BJP government.

Congress has no heart or house for Mr TharoorDespite his intellect, eloquence, and four consecutive wins from Thiruvananthapuram, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor remains an outsider in his own party. The Congress has no heart or house for Tharoor as it finds him too independent for national politics and too unconventional for Kerala's faction-ridden political affairs.
US sides with Russia at UN on Ukraine vote in stunning move, India abstainsThe United Nations General Assembly on Monday adopted two resolutions on Russia's war in Ukraine.

Will Virat Kohli overtake Sachin Tendulkar's ODI runs tally? Ricky Ponting reactsRicky Ponting has said that he will not write off Virat Kohli when it comes to overtaking Sachin Tendulkar's ODI runs tally. Kohli scored his 51st ODI hundred against Pakistan in Dubai on February 23.

MK Stalin warns Tamil Nadu could lose 8 MPs in delimitation, calls all-party meetTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin called for an all-party meeting on March 5, warning that the state could lose 8 MPs due to delimitation based on population control policies.

JEE scores matter, but so do board marks, Olympiads. Here's what colleges wantLooking for an engineering admission? Not all colleges are looking at your JEE scores; some are increasingly taking up holistic admission processes. Apart from direct entry, there are lateral routes, private exams, admissions based on extracurricular activities or Olympiad scores, and more.

LPU's 2025 Batch Final Year Student Bags Rs 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) Placement Package-Betireddy Naga Vamsi Reddy B. Tech student has secured a 1.03 Crore ($1,18,000) package with an AI robotics company and is set to graduate in May 2025. 

-Over 1,700 students have received packages ranging from Rs 10 LPA – Rs 1 Crore per annum 

-1,912 students received multiple job offers while Adireddy Vasu, secured 7 job offers, setting a rare and impressive record.

Shashi Tharoor's praise for Centre, selfie with Piyush Goyal amid rift buzzThe latest development has once again brought to focus Shashi Tharoor's souring of ties with the Congress and fuelled a buzz over his future with the party.

Pakistan media's bizarre claim on India's win is viral: 22 pandits did black magicA video from a Pakistani news channel featuring a panel discussing how their country lost to India due to 'black magic' has gone viral on social media.

Makhana is a superfood, but it's also super expensive. Here's whyMakhana is a superfood with a super price tag. The real story behind makhana's high cost lies not just in its nutritional value but in the intricate process of harvesting and processing these delicate seeds. As demand continues to rise, understanding the challenges faced by farmers and producers can help them appreciate the true worth of this superfood.

Enduring Daaku Maharaaj: 2.5 hours of second-hand embarrassmentSouth star Nandamuri Balakrishna might have impressed his fans with Daaku Maharaaj, but is it really worth all the hype? Read on to find out.
CBSE Class 10 Social Science Question Paper 2025: Check full exam paper hereCheck out the CBSE Class 10 Social Science question paper 2025 in full here.

India's first hyperloop test track. Delhi to Jaipur in 30 minutes?Delhi is not far away from Jaipur now. The 422-meter facility at IIT Madras marks a significant milestone in revolutionising transportation between major Indian cities.

Migratory birds are leaving Odisha's Bhitarkanika Park early. Here's whyMigratory birds are leaving Odisha's Bhitarkanika National Park early due to a sudden temperature rise and early summer, marking an unusual migration pattern.

Indian fashion blooms in The White Lotus season 3The White Lotus Season 3 is back with a hearty dose of drool-worthy vacation style inspiration. This season, the fashion factor boasts an Indian touch as well.

Macron intervenes, fact-checks Trump in real time on Ukraine aid: No, we paidAs the US President was answering a question about Europe's funding to Ukraine, Macron grabbed Trump's arm to interrupt him and issued a fact check.

Is Nani's HIT 3 teaser hinting at violent comeback of the 'angry cop' trope?Over the decades, Indian cinema has transformed its portrayal of police officers—from righteous law enforcers to morally complex figures. But with HIT 3 Spirit and Officer on Duty in the mix is raising questions about the comeback of the angry cop trope this time with a more violent edge.

1,200 apply for 2 internships, CEO calls out India's 'employability crisis'Unmanned Dynamics CEO Srinath Mallikarjunan warned of India's worsening employment crisis in a social media post. He criticised the education system for failing to equip graduates with real-world skills.

Drunk men assault doctors at Hassan Medical College in KarnatakaA scuffle broke out at Hassan Medical College in Karnataka, as intoxicated men attacked doctors, triggering panic. PG and MBBS students staged a protest, demanding strict action and better security measures.

AI video of Trump kissing Elon Musk's feet played on TVs at US government officeHackers allegedly hijacked HUD building monitors to play an AI-generated video of Trump kissing Musk's feet, mocking their relationship. The incident went viral, sparking online debate and official concern.

Elon Musk-Vivek Ramaswamy's X-change over Ohio Governor bid: Let's rollElon Musk endorsed his former DOGE partner Vivek Ramaswamy for the post of Governor of Ohio as he launched his campaign on Monday night.

John Abraham calls out Bollywood's 'ridiculous' actor fees: We are really sufferingJohn Abraham criticised Bollywood's high actor fees and entourage costs, urging actors to take pay cuts and focus on content. He said producers are also to blame for inflating film budgets.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja says she's celebrated birthdays alone for 12 yearsActor Govinda's wife, Sunita Ahuja, recently shared spending her birthday alone for the last 12 years.

Is Nani's HIT 3 teaser hinting at violent comeback of the 'angry cop' trope?Over the decades, Indian cinema has transformed its portrayal of police officers—from righteous law enforcers to morally complex figures. But with HIT 3 Spirit and Officer on Duty in the mix is raising questions about the comeback of the angry cop trope this time with a more violent edge.

sports.headline: Even Dhoni couldn't have helped Rizwan's team: Ex-Pakistan captain  Champions Trophy 2025: Pakistan women's skipper Sana Mir said that veterans like Younis Khan and MS Dhoni couldn't have helped the men's team from getting knocked out of the tournament on home soil.

R Ashwin in awe of Shubman Gill's technique to take down Shaheen AfridiFormer India all-rounder Ravichandran Ashwin said that he was in awe of Shubman Gill's technique after he took down Shaheen Afridi during India's clash against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy 2025.

Will Virat Kohli overtake Sachin Tendulkar's ODI runs tally? Ricky Ponting reactsRicky Ponting has said that he will not write off Virat Kohli when it comes to overtaking Sachin Tendulkar's ODI runs tally. Kohli scored his 51st ODI hundred against Pakistan in Dubai on February 23.

Court rejects Lakshya Sen's plea in birth certificate forgery caseLakshya Sen's legal troubles deepen as the Karnataka High Court dismisses his plea, allowing investigations into alleged birth certificate forgery. The case, which involves his family and coach, raises serious concerns over age fraud in Indian sport.

Pat Cummins slams Australian paper for fabricating quote on IndiaPat Cummins has called out an Australian newspaper for quoting him incorrectly about India in the Champions Trophy. Cummins hit out at the publication, stating that he never said that India had an unfair advantage in the tournament.

AUS vs SA LIVE: Rain delays toss at RawalpindiAustralia (AUS) vs South Africa (SA) Live Score, Champions Trophy: In what is already hailed to be a mega Champions Trophy clash at Rawalpindi, consistent drizzling has resulted in the toss facing a delay. Australia will take on South Africa in this Group B fixture with both sides, with their eyes set on the semi-final spot after securing big wins in their previous fixtures.

India getting huge advantage by playing at same venue: Pat CumminsInjured Australia captain Pat Cummins has said that India have a huge advantage in the Champions Trophy. Cummuns said that playing at the same venue throughout the tournament gives India a better chance of success.

Outdated Pakistan do not have a team that can win tournamentsPakistan's early Champions Trophy exit, despite hosting the tournament, has raised concerns over their cricketing structure. Parthiv Patel and Dinesh Karthik pointed out flaws in the team's approach, coaching setup, and inability to perform in high-pressure ICC events.

Clash of Champions: Virat Kohli's immortal class proves critics wrong againVirat Kohli has consistently silenced his doubters, proving his class once again with a match-winning century against Pakistan in the Champions Trophy. His redemption should remind fans to stand by their heroes, especially when they face challenging phases in their careers.

Watch: Richa Ghosh pulls off MS Dhoni-like run-out in RCB vs UPW gameRoyal Challengers Bengaluru wicketkeeper Richa Ghosh affected a MS Dhoni-like last-ball run out in the team's WPL game against UP Warriorz. Richa forced the game into WPL's first ever Super Over with some quick thinking.

MS Dhoni set to use new bats for IPL 2025, says reportLegendary MS Dhoni might be using new bats for the upcoming edition of the Indian Premier League. A report suggests that Dhoni might reduce the weight of his bat for the 2025 season.

Shanto urges batting, fielding improvement after Bangladesh's crash outBangladesh captain Najmul Shanto defended his team's bowling efforts in the Champions Trophy despite their early exit but admitted the need for major improvements in batting and fielding. Expressing disappointment, he lamented yet another embarrassing ICC tournament failure for his side.

NZ's Rachin Ravindra reveals reason behind 'simple' batting vs BangladeshNew Zealand's Rachin Ravindra credited his ability to adapt to conditions in Rawalpindi for making his century against Bangladesh look effortless. In his comeback match from injury, Ravindra found the perfect balance between timing and aggression against a strong Bangladesh bowling attack.

England's Brydon Carse out of Champions Trophy, Rehan Ahmed to join squadEngland suffered a major blow as Brydon Carse was ruled out of the Champions Trophy due to a toe injury. Rehan Ahmed replaces him, but he won't arrive in time for England's must-win clash against Afghanistan.

Champions Trophy exit in 6 days: Pakistan end 16-year tournament streak6 days after the start of the tournament, Pakistan were unceremoniously dumped out of the Champions Trophy 2025. Pakistan lost their matches against New Zealand and India in embarrassing fashion.

From face injury to Champions Trophy 100: NZ's Ravindra reflects on comebackRachin Ravindra credited New Zealand's coaches, doctors, and family for his successful return from injury, marking his comeback with a stunning century against Bangladesh that sealed the Black Caps' Champions Trophy semi-final spot in a dominant victory.

Sophie Ecclestone heroics helps Warriorz beat RCB in historic Super Over WPL 2025: Deepti Sharma's UP Warriorz beat Smriti Mandhana's Royal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) in a thrilling Super Over on Monday, February 24 at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru.

Champions Trophy: What's gone wrong with Pakistan as they exit tournamentIn a discussion with India Today Consulting Sports Editor, Nikhil Naz and Pakistani journalist Fareshteh Gati Aslam, Consulting Editor Mr. Rajdeep Sardesai discusses the reasons behind Pakistan cricket's downfall as they crash out of the Champions Trophy.

Babar Azam is a 'fraud', fans have picked 'wrong heroes': Shoaib AkhtarChampions Trophy: Shoaib Akhtar lashed out at Babar Azam and the Pakistan team after their lacklustre performance in the ongoing tournament where they have failed to win a single game thus far.

NZ vs BAN: Who said what as Rachin, Bracewell guide New Zealand into semisMichael Bracewell and Rachin Ravindra were the stars of the show as New Zealand defeated Bangladesh to reach the semi-finals of the Champions Trophy. Bracewell picked up 4 wickets while Rachin scored a fine 112.

Rachin Ravindra lights up Rawalpindi with multiple records: Stat PackChampions Trophy 2025: Rachin Ravindra scored 112 off 105 balls against Bangladesh and achieved several milestones during the Group A match on Monday at the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium.

NZ vs BAN: Huge security breach in Rawalpindi as pitch invader hugs Rachin RavindraThere was a huge security breach in Rawalpindi during the New Zealand vs Bangladesh game as a pitch invader came in and tried to hug Rachin Ravindra during the match. Rachin played a big role in New Zealand's win on the day.

New Zealand sprint to semis after Rachin Ravindra's Rawalpindi specialChampions Trophy 2025: New Zealand stormed their way into the semis after beating Najmul Hossain Shanto's Bangladesh on February 24. Rachin Ravindra scored 112 and helped the Black Caps chase down the target of 237.

India reach semifinal, Pakistan suffer embarrassing early exitChampions Trophy: India and New Zealand became the first two teams to reach the semifinal. Pakistan's title defence ended in an embarrassing manner as the hosts are out in the group stage.

After Champions Trophy debacle, Pakistan's brand value set to take big hit: ReportAfter a disastrous Champions Trophy campaign, the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) are all set to face a big challenge in getting sponsors for the men's team. The Pakistan team's brand value has taken a massive hit after their poor performance in the ongoing ICC event.

Delulu Is Only Sululu: Aakash Chopra slams Mohammad Rizwan for Axar-Jadeja remarkAakash Chopra has slammed Pakistan captain Mohammad Rizwan for his remark on Axar Patel and Ravindra Jadeja and comparing them to Agha Salman and Khushdil Shah after their loss to India in Dubai on Sunday, February 23.

Pakistan set to sack Aaqib Javed following Champions Trophy flop show: ReportChampions Trophy 2025: As per reports, PCB are set to relieve Aaqib Javed and other members of the support staff after Pakistan lost back-to-back matches against New Zealand and India in the tournament.

Don't you get paid? How Pakistan cricket greats reacted to Dubai horror showFormer Pakistan players criticised the current cricketers and the country's cricket board after the team was thrashed by India in the Champions Trophy group stage. While Wasim Akram called for bold decisions, Javed Miandad took a swipe at the players, questioning whether they were being paid enough.

Sunil Gavaskar explains how Virat Kohli countered spin demons vs Pakistan Champions Trophy 2025: In an exclusive interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar talked about how Virat Kohli countered the Pakistani spinners in Dubai after struggling against the likes of Adil Rashid and Rishad Hossain.

Did Shaheen deliberately bowl wides to Virat Kohli? Gavaskar weighs in Champions Trophy 2025: In an interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar put forth his opinions on Shaheen Shah Afridi bowling wides when Virat Kohli was on the cusp of his hundred in the clash on Sunday between India and Pakistan in Dubai.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
